H1272.def: = action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H2678.def: = pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting and in warfare

H3950.def: = causative action by which humans or animals bring together and take in objects from scattered places or sources

H113.def: = man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H3083.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Gersom<SDBH:גֵּרְשֹׁום>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► Levite assisting {L:Micah<SDBH:מִיכָיְהוּ>} and later the {L:Danites<SDBH:דָּנִי>} as {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3083.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Gersom<SDBH:גֵּרְשֹׁום>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► Levite assisting {L:Micah<SDBH:מִיכָיְהוּ>} and later the {L:Danites<SDBH:דָּנִי>} as {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H5045.def: =  an area of land located in the south of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, consisting of little vegetation and with very little annual rainfall; inhabited by numerous peoples - initially by the Canaanites in {L:Arad<SDBH:עֲרָד>} and the {L:Amelekites<SDBH:עֲמָלֵקִי>}, later, the people of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}

H681.def: relational indicating a location in the direct vicinity of the point of reference

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7812.def: = to lay oneself down on the ground ► as a sign of submission

H7969.def: = state in which a countable entity is three in number

H6471.def: = the lower part of the leg beyond the ankle, on which humans or animals stand and with which they walk

H5401.def: = action with which a person touches her or his lips to another person (usually on the lips or cheek or hand) or to an object ► to show love or respect or devotion; also used when greeting and saying goodbye

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H1058.def: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H1431.def: = process by which objects increase in size

H3083.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Gersom<SDBH:גֵּרְשֹׁום>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► Levite assisting {L:Micah<SDBH:מִיכָיְהוּ>} and later the {L:Danites<SDBH:דָּנִי>} as {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H587.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse, including those associated to him or her

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H5892.def: = relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent {L:villages<SDBH:חָצֵר>}, {L:settlements<SDBH:בַּת>}, and {L:pasturelands<SDBH:מִגְרָשׁ>}; ≈ associated with strength and security
